doc.after: Wingtip vortices are circular patterns of rotating air left behind a wing as it generates lift 1 One wingtip vortex trails from the tip of each wing Wingtip vortices are sometimes named trailing or lift induced vortices because they also occur at points other than at the wing tips 1 Indeed vorticity is trailed at any point on the wing where the lift varies span wise a fact described and quantified by the lifting line theory it eventually rolls up into large vortices near the wingtip at the edge of flap devices or at other abrupt changes in wing planform
